intro: Sesleria rigida subsp. achtarovii, commonly known as the Achtarovii sedge, is a perennial grass-like plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats. It is distinguished by its compact growth habit and distinctive floral structures. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
